articles.headline: Democrats Seek Tax on ‘Richest,’ Aiming Gauntlet at G.O.P.
articles.snippet: The 5 percent levy on incomes of more than $1 million has little chance of passing, but Democratic leaders hope it draws a contrast with Republicans who have opposed the tax.
articles.abstract: The 5 percent levy on incomes of more than $1 million has little chance of passing, but Democratic leaders hope it draws a contrast with Republicans who have opposed the tax.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In proposing a 5 percent surtax on incomes of more than $1 million a year to pay for job-creation measures sought by President Obama, Senate Democratic leaders on Wednesday escalated efforts to strike a more populist tone and to draw Republicans into a confrontation over how much affluent Americans should pay to help others cope with a struggling economy.

articles.headline: Europe Calls for Infusion of Capital for Banks
articles.snippet: The German chancellor, Angela Merkel, is ready to speed aid to financial sector, saying the situation is urgent.
articles.abstract: The German chancellor, Angela Merkel, is ready to speed aid to financial sector, saying the situation is urgent.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — As European officials brace for the potential of a Greek debt default, Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany said Wednesday that she would push for more capital to protect her nation’s banks. And European banking regulators were trying to identify the region’s most vulnerable financial institutions.

articles.headline: Freddie and Fannie Reject Debt Relief
articles.snippet: Loans are not eligible for debt reduction if they were bought and held or securitized by the two companies, which guarantee more than 70 percent of the country’s home loans.
articles.abstract: Loans are not eligible for debt reduction if they were bought and held or securitized by the two companies, which guarantee more than 70 percent of the country’s home loans.
articles.lead_paragraph: Home values have fallen so much in Arizona that almost half the people with mortgages there owe more than their homes are worth. So when federal money became available to help stem the tide of foreclosures, the state flagged that group for help.

articles.headline: Apple’s Visionary Redefined Digital Age
articles.snippet: Mr. Jobs helped usher in the era of the personal computer and led a cultural transformation in mobile communications and music for the digital age.
articles.abstract: Mr. Jobs helped usher in the era of the personal computer and led a cultural transformation in mobile communications and music for the digital age.
articles.lead_paragraph: Steven P. Jobs, the visionary co-founder of Apple who helped usher in the era of personal computers and then led a cultural transformation in the way music, movies and mobile communications were experienced in the digital age, died Wednesday. He was 56.

articles.headline: Europe Tries to Stave Off a Reckoning
articles.snippet: The problem for Europe may be that it has not had its own Lehman Brothers, at least in the sense that Lehman shocked Americans to take divisive and expensive steps to repair the damage.
articles.abstract: The problem for Europe may be that it has not had its own Lehman Brothers, at least in the sense that Lehman shocked Americans to take divisive and expensive steps to repair the damage.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — Many around the world are worried that Europe is about to face a Lehman Brothers moment, a big bankruptcy or sudden default that sets off a new phase of panic in Europe and beyond.

articles.headline: A Candidate Writing His Own Campaign Rules
articles.snippet: After winning a recent straw poll in Florida, it would seem that it is Herman Cain’s moment, but his public appearances have focused on his newly released book.
articles.abstract: After winning a recent straw poll in Florida, it would seem that it is Herman Cain’s moment, but his public appearances have focused on his newly released book.
articles.lead_paragraph: On a whirlwind trip through New York City this week that marked the beginning of a nearly monthlong book tour, Herman Cain chatted with the hosts of ABC’s “The View,” promoted his new memoir on Fox News, met local titans like Donald Trump, shared ideas with former Mayor Edward I. Koch and enjoyed power lunching in Midtown.

articles.headline: Rebirth for Soap Operas, and a Career
articles.snippet: Jeff Kwatinetz, a Hollywood executive whose rise was as quick as his fall, is kicking up dust with an online channel featuring new episodes of “One Life to Live” and “All My Children.”
articles.abstract: Jeff Kwatinetz, a Hollywood executive whose rise was as quick as his fall, is kicking up dust with an online channel featuring new episodes of “One Life to Live” and “All My Children.”
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — A decade ago, Jeff Kwatinetz was one of Hollywood’s fastest rising executives, a whiz kid from Chicago with a keen ear for rock bands and an eerie ability to foresee how the music business would evolve.

articles.headline: A Tough Balancing Act Remains Ahead for Apple
articles.snippet: Apple’s executives will have to figure out how to follow the lessons Steven P. Jobs imparted prior to his death without being trapped by his legacy and unable to adapt to future changes.
articles.abstract: Apple’s executives will have to figure out how to follow the lessons Steven P. Jobs imparted prior to his death without being trapped by his legacy and unable to adapt to future changes.
articles.lead_paragraph: As the high-tech industry mourns the death of Steven P. Jobs, Apple’s executives will face the challenge of how to keep its streak of hit products going while avoiding the problems that have befallen other companies that lost their beloved founders.

articles.headline: Court Says Regulator Exceeded Its Power
articles.snippet: A decision limits the enforcement options of Finra, an important Wall Street regulator, just as it is under pressure to impose greater accountability on brokers and firms.
articles.abstract: A decision limits the enforcement options of Finra, an important Wall Street regulator, just as it is under pressure to impose greater accountability on brokers and firms.
articles.lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court in Manhattan ruled on Wednesday that Finra, an important regulator of Wall Street for more than 70 years, does not have the right to take its members to court to enforce its disciplinary actions.

articles.headline: Central Banks Take Different Tacks on Europe’s Economy
articles.snippet: The European Central Bank said it would help banks that are having trouble raising cash, while the Bank of England decided to resume its bond purchases.
articles.abstract: The European Central Bank said it would help banks that are having trouble raising cash, while the Bank of England decided to resume its bond purchases.
articles.lead_paragraph: BERLIN — The European Central Bank increased aid to cash-strapped financial institutions Thursday, but disappointed those expecting more drastic measures to combat slowing growth and address a deepening bank emergency.
articles.byline: By Jack Ewing and Julia Werdigier

articles.headline: Making Case for Jobs Bill, Obama Cites Europe’s Woes
articles.snippet: President Obama said Thursday that the weakening economy posed an “emergency” and urged passage of his $447 billion package.
articles.abstract: President Obama said Thursday that the weakening economy posed an “emergency” and urged passage of his $447 billion package.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In perhaps his most sober remarks about the economy this year, President Obama on Thursday described the weakening economy as “an emergency” and made the case for his jobs bill as “an insurance policy against a possible double-dip recession.”
